data.title: Take out
data.text:
The service was prompt and the vegtable . soup was delicious,the shrimp was big and tasty.. We had 
crab appitisers so so..

data.title: Great Food with a View
data.text: Watched the shuttle go off eating Thai, great food, service is Excellent too, they are very helpful and accommodating.

data.title: Very good Thai food & beautiful view
data.text: We have been here to eat several times since they finally opened.  The service & the food is always good.  They are right on the river & there is a beautiful view out their windows.  Our food was very good & it was just the right temperature.  Our server was very friendly & helpful.  It has never been very busy when we go there.  I do hope they survive.  The have a good thing going.

data.title: Loved it
data.text: This place is GREAT! Bankey is such a great server/host. The view from the window was breath taking. Sometimes you can even see dolphins ! On top off all of this, the food.. It's super fresh and the presentation is out of this world. Would highly recommend this place. The prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Fantastic,fresh,great staff, and what a view!
data.text: It is a "must eatery", the view,staff,food and ambiance is unequaled in Palm Bay!  You must stop if you are anywhere nearby.  It's an experience that one must not miss,  Prices are fair with wonderful staff and environment.

data.title: Better food elsewhere.
data.text: We finally stopped in and tried since the Italian restaurant closed. The AC appeared to be not working and half the restaurant being renovated. Did not deter us from trying. We order Tempura meals, Rolls and Volcano Chicken. Really soggy and not crispy at all. Flavor of both dishes minimal and did not appear fresh at all. By pass this place unless you just come for the river view, which is spectacular.

data.title: beautiful view of the river
data.text: this restaurant sits on the Sebastian River and has big clean windows for a terrific view. the menu is Japanese and Thai and the food is good. We had a few rolls,, eel and spicy tuna, some fried dumplings, lemon-grass soups with chicken or seafood and some Thai noodle dishes. The staff was helpful.

data.title: Spicy Thai
data.text: A group of friends went during lunch and we enjoyed the food.  The menu had plenty of options.  I had the volcano shrimp and it was very good.  The service was good and the place was clean with a nice river view.

data.title: Very good Bento Box
data.text: Had lunch with my husband. We both ordered two different sushi bento box.  They both were very good. The fish was very fresh and the portion was very large.  We had to take leftover home. The view of the river was beautiful. We'll be back.

data.title: Support your local Thai!
data.text: I agree with "Wish they let people know they are open" that the word needs to get about this wonderful restaurant. This was my first time following my wife's high recommendation. Food is delicious and ample. The place feels like it's a family operation although they said it wasn't. We are from out of town and can only hope that the locals will get out and support this restaurant. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Wish they let people know they are open!
data.text:
We were so happy that our old Italian restaurant was finally coming back to life as a Thai restaurant.  We have visited several times and have never been disappointed.  The servings are great and the prices are average. 
Service has been slow at times, but everything is so hot and fresh we don't mind waiting.  Every item we have ordered has been delicious.  Sushi is made fresh to order and good variety.
Our only fear is that if business doesn't pick up, they won't last long.  They have a large lighted sign out side that has been blank since the day it was put up.  The only indication that they are open is a small neon sign in the window that is not really visible during the day.  
We will continue to order take out and dine in as it is so convenient for us.  
Hope soon they put something on the sign to let the drive by traffic that's not the locals know they are up and running.

data.title: Waterfront dining
data.text: Had a decent meal here. Green Curry w/tofu and Basil Duck. Both tasty. Service good. Great view. Could use a little more atmosphere but all said a nice place. Probably will not return as there a places with better Thai food in our area.

data.title: Yet another good Oriental restaurant
data.text: My wife and I had dinner at Thai Riverside for the first time last night. We were very favorably impressed. Of course, the location and view on the Indian River is magnificent. But, more importantly, the restaurant is very nicely decorated with plenty of comfortable seating. And the food is good. We had two appetizers, gyoza and crab rangoon. The gyoza was OK, the crab rangoon was excellent. My wife had shrimp pad thai and I had pad lomein pork. Both were very good. By the time we were finished, the room we were seated in had filled up nicely with customers. This is a very nice addition to the Palm Bay restaurant scene.

data.title: Great Thai food in convenient location on U.S. 1
data.text: Overlooks the Indian River.  Pad Thai is excellent.  Sushi platters are huge.  Staff is friendly, and service is great.  Right on U.S. 1 near Palm Harbor Marina.

data.title: Fantastic Thai overlooking the water
data.text:
What more could you ask for? Fantastic Thai food with a beautiful view of the water. 

On the week of my visit, I had already been to two other fantastic Thai restaurants in Orlando.  The folks I met for lunch wanted Thai, so what the heck, third time in a week is no problem for me. 

I was very impressed. It is one of the best Thai restaurants I have been to. I am very happy to have found this place in Brevard. 

I had red curry which could have been a little spicier. But it still had a rich coconut and curry flavor which was simply delicious. Our server was very present and did a great job. 

There were many things on the menu and I can't wait to try them all. Stop in and your sure to be pleased.

data.title: Very good meal & service
data.text: It took a long time before this restaurant was finally opened. It was being renovated for a long time. It had been an Italian restaurant for many years. We were glad to see they finally opened. We were greeted warmly & escorted to a booth. There are two dining rooms but only one was opened while we were there. I had the Pad Thai & my husband ordered the Red curry with pork. They both came with a cup of soup which was ok but not great. It was made with lots of onions & rotini  pasta. Not something you would expect in a Thai restaurant.  Our entrees were very good.  They have both Thai & Japanese offerins on the menu as well as sushi. Our server was very nice. The view is beautiful , overlooking the river.

data.title: Beautiful view, standard fare
data.text: I had lunch here with a friend today as we wanted to try it out. The view of the Indian River Lagoon is wonderful. The service was good and the food is pretty standard for a Thai restaurant. The sushi is excellent. Prices are reasonable. The only issue that I had is that they charged extra to substitute a half of a spicy salmon roll for the half of California roll in a lunch special. My regular place has not problem with the substitution.

data.title: Food was decent
data.text: Good by Central FL standards -- but not great. A relatively new place that seems a bit unfinished. Friendly helpful staff. As all Thia places care this one is a bit pricey. Great Thai Iced Tea!

data.title: Stunning view on top of the bluff overlooking the Indian River
data.text: This location was an Italian restaurant for a long time, and is on the river on U.S. 1 in Palm Bay.  It was recently renovated, and friends recommended it to us.  We went for dinner, three adults and a four and a half year old.  When you open the door, the river is right in front of you.  Everything is sparkling clean and new.  All the familiar Thai fare is there, from sushi selections, to the curries I love, and everything in between.  The staff was very friendly, and brought out a fun set of child's chopsticks for my grandson.  We had a vegetarian sushi boat, a sushi boat, nice hot red curry, and a child's fried shrimp plate.  All of us enjoyed our entrees.  Price wise, this is in line with every other Thai restaurant in our area, that is to say, very reasonable.  What you do get here, that you don't anywhere else, is the literally stunning views from your table.  As I said to them on the way out, "We will be back!"
